description: A summary of the proposed work and photographs of the trees is included.eucalyptus - The tree has reached the height of the telephone cables and is also overhanging the pavement. The plan would be to reduce the height by one third and shape the tree, reducing the width. The current dimensions are as follows:Height - 7 metres, Spread - 2.5 to 3.0 metres in all directions (ie, up to 6m across)The target dimensions are as follows;Height - 5 metres, Spread - 1.5 metres in all directions (ie. 3m across)T1 Silver Birch - to be shaped, the intention is not to reduce the height significantly just to shape and trimming the protruding branches. The current dimensions are as follows:Height - 6-7 metres, Spread - 1.5 to 2.0 metres in all directions The target dimensions are as follows;Height - 6-7 metres, Spread - 0.8 metres (ie. 1.6 metres across)T2 Red Tree - Reduce - The current dimensions are as follows;Height - 6-6.5 metres Spread (see compass points in sketch aboveWest - 2.5 metresSouth - 2.0 metresEast - 1.5 metresNorth - 0.5 metres (cut back level with the boundary)The target dimensions are as follows:Height - 4.5 - 5.0 metresSpread - 1.5 metres (West, South & East)T3 Olive - Reduce AND TO be shaped and thinned to ensure the weight is distributed more evenlyThe current dimensions are as follows;Height - 5 metres,Spread (see compass points in sketch aboveWest - 0.8 metresSouth - 1.5 metresEast - 1.5 metresNorth - 0.5 - 0.75 metres (cut back level with the boundary)The target dimensions are as follows;Height - 3.5 - 4.0 metres, Spread - 0.8 metres (West, South, East)T4 - Silver Birch - to reduce the height also to reduce the number of branches overhanging the neighbours garden, particularly those at a lower level - The current dimensions are as follows; Height - 6 metres, Spread - 1.5 to 2.0 metresThe target dimensions are as follows: Height - 4 metresSpread - 0.8 metres
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
